intro: Dracontia pileata, commonly known as the velvet tassel plant, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and distinctive, tassel-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically dark green and have a textured surface, while its flowers are small and clustered. Dracontia pileata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
